p.strong: HJSD Meet our Superintendent Finalists tomorrow (Wednesday, April 29, 2020 from 6-8pm via Zoom https://tinyurl.com/y87w932w details can be found here.

div.p:
Update: 04-16-2020:
Hagerman High School will remain under soft closure until further notice.

Update: 03-28-20:
Hagerman School District Hot Lunch Program
Will be providing Breakfast and Lunch (one pick up)
Monday March 30th until school resumes

We are providing 2 ways to pick up meals
1. Meals will be delivered to in District Bus Stops
Approximately 1 Hour after normal morning pick-up.
Please be prompt at Bus stops

ol.li: Curb side pick up at Hagerman Elementary 9am-11am

div.p:
Children do not have to live in Hagerman School District to pick up Meals
Meals are available to Every Child Ages 1-18
Children do not have to be present for parent to pick up meals
If you need to make special arrangements please contact
LuAnne Coates- luanne.coates@hjsd.org
Dear Hagerman Joint School District Parents, Students, Staff, and Patrons,

The administration and HJSD #233 Board of Trustees have decided to follow President Trump’s advisory regarding COVID-19 Pandemic. This action is being taken as a preventative measure. We are sure that you have a number of questions and hope to address as many of those questions as possible via this email. Should you have questions that have not been answered below, please feel free to contact the school office at (208) 837-4572 or (208) 837-4777.

We are working on plans for continued instruction at home in the event of an extended closure. However, this will not begin until after Spring Break. Teachers are working on site Wednesday, March 18th and Thursday the 19th. Your child(ren)’s teacher(s) may contact you individually to determine your child(ren)’s needs. More information will be coming soon.

Athletics and other extracurricular activities are suspended. While we understand the importance of athletics and extracurricular activities, the scope of this pandemic is such that student and community health is much more important. Additionally, the school will not be available for any community activity or gathering. This is to facilitate the sterilization of the physical plant.

IHSAA, the athletic governing body for Hagerman athletics, announced that all practices and events have been canceled until April 5th. Coaches will contact their athletes with activities and individualized workouts.
Food Update: Beginning March 30-April 2, Breakfast and lunch grab-n-go will be served from 9am-11am at the bus drop off by elementary school. 18 and younger eat free.

p.a: Interim Guidance for Administrators of US K-12 Schools and Childcare Programs
CDC: SHORT, EARLY SCHOOL CLOSURES PROBABLY WON’T SLOW THE SPREAD OF CORONAVIRUS

em.strong: Job applications are at the Hagerman School District Office, or online under school district tab.

h2.a: Please click HERE for the April E-Newsletter

div.p: Parents of each student attending any school receiving funds under Title I-A may request information regarding the professional qualifications of the student’s classroom teachers. This includes whether the student’s teacher have met State qualification and licensing criteria for the grade levels and subject areas in which the teacher provides instruction or meets requirements for certification obtained through alternative routes to certification. In addition, parents may request that the Title I-A school provide information on the level of achievement and academic growth of the student, if applicable and available, on each of the State academic assessments required under Title I-A {ESSA Section 1111 (6) Parents Right to Know (A, B, C)}

CORONAVIRUS GENERAL INFORMATION In response to the concerns over the Coronovirus, Idaho has limited cases. The CDC prevention recommends the following prevention methods: *Students stay home when sick until at least 24 hours after fever is gone without the use of fever-reducing medicine. *Students should cover coughs or sneezes with a bent arm or tissue and wash hands afterwards. *Students should wash hands with soap and water for 20 seconds, dry hand with a paper towel, and use the paper towel to turn off the faucet. Students should try to keep hands away from nose, mouth, and eyes and avoid sharing food, drinks, cosmetics or personal care items (lip balm, eye drops, etc.). *Students should use an alcohol based hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol if soap and water are not available. Cleaning and disinfecting frequently touched objects and surfaces. Please contact Hagerman School District Administration with any concerns or questions.

strong.em: Hardcopy newsletters are now going to be posted under the Academics Tab at the top right of the webpage.

div.div:
School BoardBryan Whitmarsh, Chairman-Zone 4
Monte Osborne, Vice-Chairman Zone 1
Terri Dorchuck-Zone 2
Brian Moore, Trustee-Zone 3 Phil gossi - Trustee - Zone 5
